page.title: 05HOME LIFE
page.content: HOME LIFE A typical day for the Boaitts is to get up at 6,45 a.m. and have a cup of tea. The children then get up and have breakfast. Mr. Boaitt goes to work and Mrs. Boaitt cleans up which takes until 9.00. She then takes the twins to the play group in Tibberton and this gives her time to look after the baby, housework and shopping. Before lunch she has to pick the twins up. At 1.45 some friends come to play for the afternoon. At 5.00 they then have tea and if the weather is good they have a walk after tea. At the end of the day the children have a bath which takes till about 6.30 when Mr. Boaitt comes home. The children go to bed at 7.00 and Mr. and Mrs. Boaitt can then relax. They go to bed at about 12.00.
